required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Project Q Pilot: Smoking Cessation for Light Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: Project Q Pilot: Examining Different Treatment Modalities to Maximize Cessation Efforts for Light Smokers

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot study is to evaluate the feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary efficacy of an intervention to promote smoking cessation among light smokers.

detailed_description.textblock: The three-arm randomized controlled trial compares Arm 1) standard smoking cessation plus support text messages, 2) enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + D-cycloserine placebo, Arm 3)will include a combination of cognitive behavioral cessation counseling, enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) and a cognitive-enhancing drug - D-cycloserine. In addition to an in-person screening visit, we will conduct three in-person treatment visits and an inperson follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Completion of at Least 2 Study Visits
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility will be determined by number of participants that complete at least 2 study visits.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Rated the Intervention Acceptable
primary_outcome.description: Acceptability will be determined by the number of patients rating the intervention usefulness in the experimental and control arms on a 7-point Likert scale, where 1=extremely useless and 7=extremely useful.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Validated Cessation
secondary_outcome.description: Biochemically-validated cessation (absence of salivary cotinine) 1 week post-intervention.

arm_group.description: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo Comparator: Counseling and placebo drug intervention
arm_group.description: enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + DCS placebo

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active Comparator: Counseling and active drug intervention
arm_group.description: enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + active DCS. In addition to an in-person screening visit, we will conduct three in-person treatment visits and an in-person follow-up visit.

intervention.description: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages
intervention.arm_group_label: Active Comparator: Counseling and active drug intervention
Placebo Comparator: Counseling and placebo drug intervention

intervention.description: Enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + DCS placebo
intervention.arm_group_label: Placebo Comparator: Counseling and placebo drug intervention

intervention.description: Enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting)+ active DCS. In addition to an in-person, screening visit, we will conduct three in-person treatment visits and an in-person follow-up visit.
intervention.arm_group_label: Active Comparator: Counseling and active drug intervention

facility.name: Duke University Medical Center - Cancer Prevention, Detection and Control

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Experimental: Cognitive Behavioral Cessation Counseling
group.description: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages Cognitive behavioral cessation counseling: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages

group.title: Placebo Comparator: Counseling and Placebo Drug Intervention
group.description: enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + DCS placebo Cognitive behavioral cessation counseling: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages Counseling and placebo drug intervention: Enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + DCS placebo

group.title: Active Comparator: Counseling and Active Drug Intervention
group.description: enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + active DCS. In addition to an in-person screening visit, we will conduct three in-person treatment visits and an in-person follow-up visit. Cognitive behavioral cessation counseling: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages Counseling and active drug intervention: Enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting)+ active DCS. In addition to an in-person, screening visit, we will conduct three in-person treatment visits and an in-person follow-up visit.

baseline.population: In the comparator standard counseling, one enrolled patient withdrew prior to completing the baseline survey. Three participants in the active comparator arm did not complete the baseline survey.

group.title: Experimental: Cue-based Treatment
group.description: Enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) Cognitive behavioral cessation counseling: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages

group.title: Comparator: Standard Counseling
group.description: Cognitive behavioral cessation counseling: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages

group.title: Active Comparator: Counseling and Active Drug Intervention
group.description: enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting) + active DCS. In addition to an in-person screening visit, we will conduct three in-person treatment visits and an in-person follow-up visit. Cognitive behavioral cessation counseling: Standard smoking cessation plus support text messages Counseling and active drug intervention: Enhanced cue exposure treatment (lab-based + interactive SMS texting)+ active DCS. In addition to an in-person, screening visit, we will conduct three in-person treatment visits and an in-person follow-up visit.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Education: Some college or college grad
Nicotine Dependence
measure.description: Measured by the Fagerstrom Test For Nicotine Dependence (FTND). The FTND has a range of 0-10. The higher the Fagerstrom score, the more intense is the patient's physical dependence on nicotine.

measure.title: Native Light Smoker
measure.description: Native light smoker is defined as a participant smoker who has never smoked more than 10 cigarettes per day

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Completion of at Least 2 Study Visits
outcome.description: Feasibility will be determined by number of participants that complete at least 2 study visits.
outcome.population: Only one participant in the "Active Comparator" arm completed the study.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Completion of at Least 2 Study Visits

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Rated the Intervention Acceptable
outcome.description: Acceptability will be determined by the number of patients rating the intervention usefulness in the experimental and control arms on a 7-point Likert scale, where 1=extremely useless and 7=extremely useful.
outcome.population: The primary outcome was defined as acceptability across the entire sample.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Findings are not conclusive due to the pilot nature of the study.
